question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetValidCandidates()] [Hex Conversion] Can repeated .ToHex() calls at lines 91-93 cause performance degradation with large candidate lists? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinersCount()] [Range Validation] Does State.MinersCount.Value have bounds checking elsewhere to prevent setting to negative values or unreasonably large values? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetElectionResult()] [Snapshot Validation] Does GetVotingResult validate that input.TermNumber exists, or can querying non-existent terms return empty/invalid voting results? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetElectionResult()] [State Sync] At line 113, does comparing input.TermNumber == State.CurrentTermNumber.Value accurately reflect active status if CurrentTermNumber updates mid-query? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetElectionResult()] [Data Integrity] Can votingResult.Results contain manipulated or stale voting data if VoteContract state is corrupted? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetElectionResult()] [Term Number Validation] Does the function validate input.TermNumber against reasonable bounds to prevent querying terms too far in past/future? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetCandidateInformation()] [Default Return] Does returning new CandidateInformation { Pubkey = input.Value } at line 122 when candidate not found mask the difference between non-existent and uninitialized candidates? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetCandidateInformation()] [Input Validation] Can input.Value be null, empty, or malformed hex string causing ToHex() conversion failures in dependent code? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetCandidateInformation()] [State Mapping] Can State.CandidateInformationMap[input.Value] return outdated information if candidate replaced their pubkey but mapping not updated? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetTermSnapshot()] [Snapshot Existence] Does returning new TermSnapshot() when State.Snapshots[input.TermNumber] is null hide legitimate errors vs. uninitialized snapshots? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetTermSnapshot()] [Term Bounds] Can input.TermNumber be negative, zero, or exceed current term causing incorrect snapshot retrieval? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetPreviousTermSnapshotWithNewestPubkey()] [Invalid Candidate Removal] At lines 135-141, does removing candidates with r.Value <= 0 incorrectly exclude candidates with exactly 0 votes who should remain? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetPreviousTermSnapshotWithNewestPubkey()] [Empty Result] Does returning snapshot at line 143 when !snapshot.ElectionResult.Any() represent a valid state or corruption that should be handled differently? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetPreviousTermSnapshotWithNewestPubkey()] [Banned Check] Does IsPubkeyBanned() at line 145 check current ban status or snapshot-time status, potentially including/excluding wrong miners? (High)
